etymology.description: Depicts a vertical eye of a man looking downwards
etymology.interpretation: The character 臣(chén) originally depicted an eye oriented vertically, symbolizing a person looking downwards, conveying subordination or observance. Over time, it evolved to represent roles such as 'slave,' 'servant,' and 'minister,' emphasizing relationships defined by subservience.

examples.chinese: 臣愿为国家尽忠(臣願為國家盡忠)。
examples.english: I, as a loyal subject, am willing to serve the nation faithfully.

examples.chinese: 陛下召见臣(陛下召見臣)，臣必不辱使命(臣必不辱使命)。
examples.pinyin: Bìxià zhàojiàn chén, chén bì bù rǔ shǐmìng。
examples.english: Your Majesty summons me, and I will not fail in my duty.

examples.chinese: 昔日臣拜见明君(昔日臣拜見明君)，如今仍怀赤诚之心(如今仍懷赤誠之心)。
examples.pinyin: Xīrì chén bàijiàn míngjūn, rújīn réng huái chìchéng zhī xīn。
examples.english: In the past, I paid my respects to a wise ruler, and even now I remain sincerely devoted.
